00068 /* PKI AURA and BPID count are equal to FPA AURA count */
00069 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_AURA              (cvmx_fpa3_num_auras())
00070 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_BPID              (cvmx_fpa3_num_auras())
00071 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_SSO_GROUP         (cvmx_sso_num_xgrp())
00072 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER_GROUP_MAX 1
00073 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER_GROUP     (cvmx_pki_num_cl_grp())
00074 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER           (cvmx_pki_num_clusters())
00075 
00076 /* FIXME: Reduce some of these values, convert to routines XXX */
00077 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_CHANNEL        4096
00078 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_PKIND          64
00079 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_INTERNAL_STYLE 256
00080 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_FINAL_STYLE    64
00081 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_QPG_ENTRY      2048
00082 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_MTAG_IDX       (32 / 4) /* 32 registers grouped by 4*/
00083 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_LTYPE          32
00084 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_BANK      2
00085 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_ENTRY     192
00086 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_FRAME_CHECK    2
00087 #define CVMX_PKI_NUM_BELTYPE        32
00088 #define CVMX_PKI_MAX_FRAME_SIZE     65535
00089 #define CVMX_PKI_FIND_AVAL_ENTRY    (-1)
00090 #define CVMX_PKI_CLUSTER_ALL        0xf

00092 #ifdef CVMX_SUPPORT_SEPARATE_CLUSTER_CONFIG
00093 #define CVMX_PKI_TOTAL_PCAM_ENTRY \
00094     ((CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER) * (CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_BANK) * (CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_ENTRY))
00095 #else
00096 #define CVMX_PKI_TOTAL_PCAM_ENTRY (CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_BANK * CVMX_PKI_NUM_PCAM_ENTRY)
00097 #endif

00099 static inline unsigned cvmx_pki_num_clusters(void)
00100 {
00101     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00102         return 2;
00103     return 4;
00104 }
00105 static inline unsigned cvmx_pki_num_cl_grp(void)
00106 {
00107     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) ||
00108         OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) ||
00109         OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00110         return 1;
00111     return 0;
00112 }

00114 enum cvmx_pki_pkind_parse_mode {
00115     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_LA_TO_LG = 0, /* Parse LA(L2) to LG */
00116     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_LB_TO_LG = 1, /* Parse LB(custom) to LG */
00117     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_LC_TO_LG = 3, /* Parse LC(L3) to LG */
00118     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_LG       = 0x3f, /* Parse LG */
00119     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_NOTHING  = 0x7f /* Parse nothing */
00120 };
00121 
00122 enum cvmx_pki_parse_mode_chg {
00123     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_NO_CHG     = 0x0,
00124     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_SKIP_TO_LB = 0x1,
00125     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_SKIP_TO_LC = 0x3,
00126     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_SKIP_TO_LD = 0x7,
00127     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_SKIP_TO_LG = 0x3f,
00128     CVMX_PKI_PARSE_SKIP_ALL   = 0x7f,
00129 };
00130 
00131 enum cvmx_pki_l2_len_mode {
00132     PKI_L2_LENCHK_EQUAL_GREATER = 0,
00133     PKI_L2_LENCHK_EQUAL_ONLY
00134 };
00135 
00136 enum cvmx_pki_cache_mode {
00137     CVMX_PKI_OPC_MODE_STT      = 0LL, /* All blocks write through DRAM,*/
00138     CVMX_PKI_OPC_MODE_STF      = 1LL, /* All blocks into L2 */
00139     CVMX_PKI_OPC_MODE_STF1_STT = 2LL, /* 1st block L2, rest DRAM */
00140     CVMX_PKI_OPC_MODE_STF2_STT = 3LL /* 1st, 2nd blocks L2, rest DRAM */
00141 };
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * Tag type definitions
00145  */
00146 enum cvmx_sso_tag_type {
00147     CVMX_SSO_TAG_TYPE_ORDERED  = 0L, /**< Tag ordering is maintained */
00148     CVMX_SSO_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC   = 1L,
00149         /**< Tag ordering is maintained, and at most one PP has the tag */
00150     CVMX_SSO_TAG_TYPE_UNTAGGED = 2L, /**< The work queue entry from the order
00151         - NEVER tag switch from NULL to NULL */
00152     CVMX_SSO_TAG_TYPE_EMPTY    = 3L
00153         /**< A tag switch to NULL, and there is no space reserved in POW
00154         - NEVER tag switch to NULL_NULL
00155         - NEVER tag switch from NULL_NULL
00156         - NULL_NULL is entered at the beginning of time and on a deschedule.
00157         - NULL_NULL can be exited by a new work request.
00158         A NULL_SWITCH load can also switch the state to NULL */
00159 };
00160

00163     CVMX_PKI_QPG_QOS_VLAN,
00164     CVMX_PKI_QPG_QOS_MPLS,
00165     CVMX_PKI_QPG_QOS_DSA_SRC,
00166     CVMX_PKI_QPG_QOS_DIFFSERV,
00167     CVMX_PKI_QPG_QOS_HIGIG,
00168 };

00171     CVMX_PKI_USE_FIRST_VLAN = 0,
00172     CVMX_PKI_USE_SECOND_VLAN
00173 };

00175 /**
00176  * Controls how the PKI statistics counters are handled
00177  * The PKI_STAT*_X registers can be indexed either by port kind (pkind), or
00178  * final style. (Does not apply to the PKI_STAT_INB* registers.)
00179  *    0 = X represents the packet’s pkind
00180  *    1 = X represents the low 6-bits of packet’s final style
00181  */
00182 enum cvmx_pki_stats_mode {
00183     CVMX_PKI_STAT_MODE_PKIND,
00184     CVMX_PKI_STAT_MODE_STYLE
00185 };
00186 
00187 enum cvmx_pki_fpa_wait {
00188     CVMX_PKI_DROP_PKT,
00189     CVMX_PKI_WAIT_PKT
00190 };

00192 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__NONE_M 0x0
00193 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__MISC_M 0x1
00194 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__IP4_M  0x2
00195 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__IP6_M  0x3
00196 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__TCP_M  0x4
00197 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__UDP_M  0x5
00198 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__SCTP_M 0x6
00199 #define PKI_BELTYPE_E__SNAP_M 0x7

00205     CVMX_PKI_BELTYPE_IP4  = PKI_BELTYPE_E__IP4_M,
00206     CVMX_PKI_BELTYPE_IP6  = PKI_BELTYPE_E__IP6_M,
00207     CVMX_PKI_BELTYPE_TCP  = PKI_BELTYPE_E__TCP_M,

00219 struct cvmx_pki_tag_fields {
00220     uint64_t layer_g_src :1;
00221     uint64_t layer_f_src :1;
00222     uint64_t layer_e_src :1;
00223     uint64_t layer_d_src :1;
00224     uint64_t layer_c_src :1;
00225     uint64_t layer_b_src :1;
00226     uint64_t layer_g_dst :1;
00227     uint64_t layer_f_dst :1;
00228     uint64_t layer_e_dst :1;
00229     uint64_t layer_d_dst :1;
00230     uint64_t layer_c_dst :1;
00231     uint64_t layer_b_dst :1;
00232     uint64_t input_port :1;
00233     uint64_t mpls_label :1;
00234     uint64_t first_vlan :1;
00235     uint64_t second_vlan :1;
00236     uint64_t ip_prot_nexthdr :1;
00237     uint64_t tag_sync :1;
00238     uint64_t tag_spi :1;
00239     uint64_t tag_gtp :1;
00240     uint64_t tag_vni :1;
00241 };
00242 
00243 struct cvmx_pki_pkind_parse {
00244     uint64_t mpls_en :1;    /**< Enable MPLS parsing.
00245         0 = Any MPLS labels are ignored, but may be handled by custom
00246         Ethertype PCAM matchers.
00247         1 = MPLS label stacks are parsed and skipped over.
00248         PKI_GBL_PEN[MPLS_PEN] must be set.*/
00249     uint64_t inst_hdr :1; /**< INST header.
00250         When set, the eight-byte INST_HDR is present on all packets
00251         (except incoming packets on the DPI ports). */
00252     uint64_t lg_custom :1; /**< Layer G Custom Match Enable.
00253         0 = Disable custom LG header extraction
00254         1 = Enable custom LG header extraction.*/
00255     uint64_t fulc_en :1;    /**< Enable Fulcrum tag parsing.
00256         0 = Any Fulcrum header is ignored.
00257         1 = Fulcrum header is parsed.*/
00258     uint64_t dsa_en :1; /**< Enable DSA parsing.
00259         This field should not be set for DPI ports.
00260         0 = Any DSA header is ignored.
00261         1 = DSA is parsed. */
00262     uint64_t hg2_en :1; /**< Enable HiGig 2 parsing.
00263         This field should not be set for DPI ports.
00264         0 = Any HiGig2 header is ignored.
00265         1 = HiGig2 is parsed. PKI_GBL_PEN[HG_PEN] must be set. */
00266     uint64_t hg_en :1; /**< Enable HiGig parsing.
00267         This field should not be set for DPI ports.
00268         0 = Any HiGig header is ignored.
00269         1 = HiGig is parsed. PKI_GBL_PEN[HG_PEN] must be set.
00270         At most one of FULC_EN, DSA_EN or HG_EN may be set. */
00271 };
00272

00276     uint64_t buffer_size;
00277     uint64_t buffer_count;
00278 };

00312 /* This is per style structure for configuring port parameters,
00313  * it is kind of of profile which can be assigned to any port.
00314  * If multiple ports are assigned same style be aware that modifying
00315  * that style will modify the respective parameters for all the ports
00316  * which are using this style
00317  */
00318 struct cvmx_pki_style_parm {
00319 
00320     bool ip6_udp_opt; /**< IPv6/UDP checksum is optional.
00321         IPv4 allows an optional UDP checksum by sending the all-0s patterns.
00322         IPv6 outlaws this and the spec says to always check UDP checksum.
00323         0 = Spec compliant, do not allow optional code.
00324         1 = Treat IPv6 as IPv4; */
00325     bool lenerr_en; /**< L2 length error check enable.
00326         Check if frame was received with L2 length error. */
00327     bool maxerr_en; /**< Max frame error check enable. */
00328     bool minerr_en; /**< Min frame error check enable. */
00329     uint8_t lenerr_eqpad; /**< L2 length checks exact pad size.
00330         0 = Length check uses greater then or equal comparison.
00331         1 = Length check uses equal comparison.*/
00332     uint8_t minmax_sel; /**< Selects which PKI_FRM_LEN_CHK(0..1) register is used
00333         for this pkind for MINERR and MAXERR */
00334     bool qpg_dis_grptag; /**< Disable computing group using WQE[TAG].
00335         1 -- Disable 0 -- Enable */
00336     bool fcs_strip; /**< Strip L2 FCS bytes from packet, decrease WQE[LEN] by 4 bytes.*/
00337     bool fcs_chk; /**< FCS checking enabled.*/
00338     bool rawdrp; /**< Allow RAW packet drop
00339         0 = Never drop packets with WQE[RAW] set.
00340         1 = Allow the PKI to drop RAW packets based on
00341         PKI_AURA(0..1023)_CFG[ENA_RED/ENA_DROP]. */
00342     bool force_drop; /**< Force packet dropping.
00343         0 = Drop packet based on PKI_AURA(0..1023)_CFG[ENA_RED/ENA_DROP].
00344         1 = Always drop the packet. Overrides NODROP, RAWDRP. */
00345     bool nodrop; /**< Disable QoS packet drop.
00346         0 = Allowed to drop packet based on PKI_AURA(0..1023)_CFG[ENA_RED/ENA_DROP].
00347         1 = Never drop the packet. Overrides RAWDRP. */
00348     bool qpg_dis_padd; /**< Disable computing port adder by QPG algorithm. */
00349     bool qpg_dis_grp; /**< Disable computing group by QPG algorithm. */
00350     bool qpg_dis_aura; /**< Disable computing aura by QPG algorithm. */
00351     uint16_t qpg_base; /**< Base index into PKI_QPG_TBL(0..2047)*/
00352     enum cvmx_pki_qpg_qos qpg_qos; /**< Algorithm to select QoS field in QPG calculation */
00353     uint8_t qpg_port_sh; /**< MSB to take from port number in QPG calculation
00354         0 = Exclude port number from QPG.
00355         4 = Include port<3:0>.
00356         8 = Include port<7:0>.*/
00357     uint8_t qpg_port_msb; /**< Number of bits to shift port number in QPG */
00358     uint8_t apad_nip; /**< Value for WQE[APAD] when packet is not IP. */
00359     uint8_t wqe_vs; /**< Which VLAN to put into WQE[VLPTR] when VLAN stacking.
00360         0 = Use the first (in network order) VLAN or DSA VID.
00361         1 = Use the second (in network order) VLAN. */
00362     enum cvmx_sso_tag_type tag_type; /**< SSO tag type to schedule to */
00363     bool pkt_lend; /**< Packet little-endian.write operations of packet data
00364         to L2C to be in LE */
00365     uint8_t wqe_hsz; /**< Work queue header size:
00366         0x0 = WORD0..4, standard WQE_S.
00367         Note FIRST_SKIP may be set to not include WORD4 in memory.
00368         0x1 = WORD0..5
00369         0x2 = WORD0..6
00370         0x3 = WORD0..7
00371         else = Reserved */
00372     uint16_t wqe_skip; /**< in bytes, WQE start offset.
00373         The number of bytes to skip between the buffer
00374         Pointer and WORD0 of the work-queue entry.*/
00375     uint16_t first_skip; /**< in bytes, The number of bytes from the top
00376         of the first MBUF, that the PKI stores the next pointer.*/
00377     uint16_t later_skip; /**< in bytes, The number of bytes from the top
00378         of any MBUF, that is not the first MBUF that PKI writes
00379         next-pointer to.*/
00380     enum cvmx_pki_cache_mode cache_mode; /**< Select the style of write to the L2C.
00381         0 = all packet data and next-buffer pointers are written through to memory.
00382         1 = all packet data and next-buffer pointers are written into the cache.
00383         2 = the first aligned cache block holding the WQE and/or front packet data
00384         are written to the L2 cache. All remaining cache blocks are not written to
00385         the L2 cache.
00386         3 = the first two aligned cache blocks holding the WQE and front packet data
00387         are written to the L2 cache. All remaining cache blocks are not written to
00388         the L2 cache. */
00389     uint8_t dis_wq_dat; /**< Separate first data buffer from the work queue entry.
00390         0 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] immediately followed
00391         by packet data, in the same buffer as the work queue entry.
00392         1 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] in a new buffer
00393         separate from the work queue entry.*/
00394     uint64_t mbuff_size; /**< in bytes, The number of bytes to store into a buffer.
00395         This must be even, in the range of 32 to 4096 and this must be
00396         less than or equal to the maximum size of every free page in every FPA pool
00397         this style may use. */
00398     bool len_lg; /**< Check length of Layer G. */
00399     bool len_lf; /**< Check length of Layer F. */
00400     bool len_le; /**< Check length of Layer E. */
00401     bool len_ld; /**< Check length of Layer D. */
00402     bool len_lc; /**< Check length of Layer C. */
00403     bool len_lb; /**< Check length of Layer B. */
00404     bool csum_lg; /**< Compute checksum on Layer G. */
00405     bool csum_lf; /**< Compute checksum on Layer F. */
00406     bool csum_le; /**< Compute checksum on Layer E. */
00407     bool csum_ld; /**< Compute checksum on Layer D. */
00408     bool csum_lc; /**< Compute checksum on Layer C. */
00409     bool csum_lb; /**< Compute checksum on Layer B. */
00410 };
00411 
00412 /* This is per style structure for configuring port's tag configuration,
00413  * it is kind of of profile which can be assigned to any port.
00414  * If multiple ports are assigned same style be aware that modiying that style
00415  * will modify the respective parameters for all the ports which are
00416  * using this style */
00417 enum cvmx_pki_mtag_ptrsel {
00418     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_SOP = 0,
00419     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LA = 8,
00420     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LB = 9,
00421     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LC = 10,
00422     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LD = 11,
00423     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LE = 12,
00424     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LF = 13,
00425     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_LG = 14,
00426     CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_VL = 15,
00427 };
00428 
00429 struct cvmx_pki_mask_tag {
00430     bool enable;
00431     int base; /* CVMX_PKI_MTAG_PTRSEL_XXX */
00432     int offset; /* Offset from base. */
00433     uint64_t val; /* Bitmask:
00434         1 = enable, 0 = disabled for each byte in the 64-byte array.*/
00435 };

00437 struct cvmx_pki_style_tag_cfg {
00438     struct cvmx_pki_tag_fields tag_fields;
00439     struct cvmx_pki_mask_tag mask_tag[4];
00440 };

00442 struct cvmx_pki_style_config {

00444     struct cvmx_pki_style_tag_cfg  tag_cfg; /**< Tag parameter configuration. */

00447 struct cvmx_pki_pkind_config {
00448     uint8_t cluster_grp; /**< Cluster group that will service traffic on this pkind */
00449     bool fcs_pres; /**< FCS present.
00450         0 = FCS not present. FCS may not be checked nor stripped.
00451         1 = FCS present; the last four bytes of the packet are part of the FCS
00452         and may not be considered part of a IP, TCP or other header for length
00453         error checks.*/
00454     struct cvmx_pki_pkind_parse parse_en;
00455     enum cvmx_pki_pkind_parse_mode initial_parse_mode;
00456     uint8_t fcs_skip;
00457     uint8_t inst_skip; /**< Skip amount from front of packet to first byte covered
00458         by FCS start. The skip must be even. If PTP_MODE, the 8-byte timestamp is
00459         prepended to the packet, and FCS_SKIP must be at least 8.*/
00460     int initial_style; /**< Skip amount from front of packet to begin parsing at.
00461         If PKI_CL(0..3)_PKIND(0..63)_CFG[INST_HDR] is set, points at the first
00462         byte of the instruction header. If INST_HDR is clear, points at the first
00463         byte to begin parsing at. The skip must be even. If PTP_MODE, the 8-byte
00464         timestamp is prepended to the packet, and INST_SKIP must be at least 8. */
00465     bool custom_l2_hdr; /**< Valid.custom L2 hesder extraction
00466         0 = Disable custom L2 header extraction.
00467         1 = Enable custom L2 header extraction.
00468         PKI_GBL_PEN[CLG_PEN] must be set. */
00469     uint8_t l2_scan_offset; /**< Scan offset for custom L2 header.
00470         Pointer to first byte of 32-bit custom extraction header, as absolute
00471         number of bytes from beginning of packet. If PTP_MODE, the 8-byte timestamp
00472         is prepended to the packet, and must be included in counting offset bytes. */
00473     uint64_t lg_scan_offset; /**< Scan offset for custom lg header.
00474         Pointer to first byte of 32-bit custom extraction header, as relative number
00475         of bytes from WQE[LFPTR]. */
00476 };
00477 
00478 struct cvmx_pki_port_config {
00479     struct cvmx_pki_pkind_config pkind_cfg; /**< Parameters can be configure per pkind */
00480     struct cvmx_pki_style_config style_cfg; /**< Parameters are configured per style,
00481         style is a profile, which can be applied to multiple ports which have same
00482         configuration and packet processing */
00483 };
00484 
00485 struct cvmx_pki_global_parse {
00486     uint64_t virt_pen :1; /**< Virtualization parsing enable.*/
00487     uint64_t clg_pen :1;    /**< Custom LG parsing enable. */
00488     uint64_t cl2_pen :1;    /**< Custom L2 parsing enable.*/
00489     uint64_t l4_pen :1; /**< L4 parsing enable.*/
00490     uint64_t il3_pen :1; /**< L3 inner parsing enable. Must be zero if L3_PEN is zero. */
00491     uint64_t l3_pen :1; /**< L3 parsing enable.*/
00492     uint64_t mpls_pen :1; /**< MPLS parsing enable.*/
00493     uint64_t fulc_pen :1; /**< Fulcrum parsing enable.*/
00494     uint64_t dsa_pen :1; /**< DSA parsing enable. Must be zero if HG_PEN is set.*/
00495     uint64_t hg_pen :1; /**< HiGig parsing enable. Must be zero if DSA_PEN is set.*/
00496 };
00497 
00498 struct cvmx_pki_tag_sec {
00499     uint16_t dst6; /**< Secret for the destination tuple IPv6 tag CRC calculation.
00500         Typically identical to SRC6 to insure tagging is symmetric between
00501         source/destination flows. Typically different from DST for maximum security. */
00502     uint16_t src6; /**< Secret for the source tuple IPv6 tag CRC calculation.
00503         Typically different from SRC for maximum security. */
00504     uint16_t dst; /**< Secret for the destination tuple tag CRC calculation.
00505         Typically identical to DST6 to insure tagging is symmetric between
00506         source/destination flows. */
00507     uint16_t src; /**< Secret for the source tuple tag CRC calculation. */
00508 };
00509 
00510 struct cvmx_pki_global_config {
00511     uint64_t cluster_mask[CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER_GROUP_MAX]; /**< Mask of clusters
00512         associated with that cluster group, there are 4 cluster groups and 4 clusters
00513         which can be assigned to cluster groups */
00514     enum cvmx_pki_stats_mode stat_mode; /**< The PKI_STAT*_X registers can be indexed
00515         either by pkind or final style.
00516         (Does not apply to the PKI_STAT_INB* registers.)
00517         0 = X represents the packet's pkind
00518         1 = X represents the low 6-bits of packet's final style */
00519     enum cvmx_pki_fpa_wait fpa_wait; /**< Policy when FPA runs out of buffers:
00520         0 = Drop the remainder of the packet requesting the buffer, and
00521         set WQE[OPCODE] to RE_MEMOUT.
00522         1 = Wait until buffers become available, only dropping packets if
00523         buffering ahead of PKI fills. This may lead to head-of-line
00524         blocking of packets on other Auras */
00525     struct cvmx_pki_global_parse gbl_pen; /**< Controls Global parsing options for chip */
00526     struct cvmx_pki_tag_sec tag_secret; /**< Secret value for src/dst tag tuple to
00527         reduce cache collision attacks */
00528     struct cvmx_pki_frame_len frm_len[CVMX_PKI_NUM_FRAME_CHECK]; /**< Values for max
00529         and min frame length to check against,2 combination */
00530     enum cvmx_pki_beltype ltype_map[CVMX_PKI_NUM_BELTYPE]; /**< Map of which protocol
00531         maps to what layer */
00532     /* struct cvmx_pki_tag_ctl  tag_ctl[32]; */
00533     /* cvmx_pki_tag_incx_mask_t tag_mask[32]; */
00534     int pki_enable;
00535 };

00601 #define CVMX_PKI_DMACH_SHIFT      32
00602 #define CVMX_PKI_DMACH_MASK       cvmx_build_mask(16)
00603 #define CVMX_PKI_DMACL_MASK       CVMX_PKI_DATA_MASK_32
00604 #define CVMX_PKI_DATA_MASK_32     cvmx_build_mask(32)
00605 #define CVMX_PKI_DATA_MASK_16     cvmx_build_mask(16)
00606 #define CVMX_PKI_DMAC_MATCH_EXACT cvmx_build_mask(48)

00608 struct cvmx_pki_pcam_input {
00609     uint64_t style;
00610     uint64_t style_mask; /* bits: 1-match, 0-dont care */
00611     enum cvmx_pki_term field;
00612     uint32_t field_mask; /* bits: 1-match, 0-dont care */
00613     uint64_t data;
00614     uint64_t data_mask; /* bits: 1-match, 0-dont care */
00615 };
00616

00618     enum cvmx_pki_parse_mode_chg parse_mode_chg;

00620     int style_add;
00621     int parse_flag_set;
00622     int pointer_advance;
00623 };

00630     struct cvmx_pki_pcam_action pcam_action;

00633 /**
00634  * Status statistics for a port
00635  */
00636 struct cvmx_pki_port_stats {
00637     uint64_t dropped_octets; /**< Inbound octets marked to be dropped by the IPD */
00638     uint64_t dropped_packets; /**< Inbound packets marked to be dropped by the IPD */
00639     uint64_t pci_raw_packets; /**< RAW PCI Packets received by PKI per port */
00640     uint64_t octets; /**< Number of octets processed by PKI */
00641     uint64_t packets; /**< Number of packets processed by PKI */
00642     uint64_t multicast_packets; /**< Number of indentified L2 multicast packets.
00643         Does not include broadcast packets.
00644         Only includes packets whose parse mode is SKIP_TO_L2 */
00645     uint64_t broadcast_packets; /**< Number of indentified L2 broadcast packets.
00646         Does not include multicast packets.
00647         Only includes packets whose parse mode is SKIP_TO_L2 */
00648     uint64_t len_64_packets; /**< Number of 64B packets */
00649     uint64_t len_65_127_packets; /**< Number of 65-127B packets */
00650     uint64_t len_128_255_packets; /**< Number of 128-255B packets */
00651     uint64_t len_256_511_packets; /**< Number of 256-511B packets */
00652     uint64_t len_512_1023_packets; /**< Number of 512-1023B packets */
00653     uint64_t len_1024_1518_packets; /**< Number of 1024-1518B packets */
00654     uint64_t len_1519_max_packets; /**< Number of 1519-max packets */
00655     uint64_t fcs_align_err_packets; /**< Number of packets with FCS or Align opcode errors */
00656     uint64_t runt_packets; /**< Number of packets with length < min */
00657     uint64_t runt_crc_packets; /**< Number of packets with length < min and FCS error */
00658     uint64_t oversize_packets; /**< Number of packets with length > max */
00659     uint64_t oversize_crc_packets; /**< Number of packets with length > max and FCS error */
00660     uint64_t inb_packets; /**< Number of packets without GMX/SPX/PCI errors received by PKI */
00661     uint64_t inb_octets; /**< Total number of octets from all packets received by PKI,
00662         including CRC */
00663     uint64_t inb_errors; /**< Number of packets with GMX/SPX/PCI errors received by PKI */
00664     uint64_t mcast_l2_red_packets; /**< Number of packets with L2 Multicast DMAC
00665         that were dropped due to RED.
00666         The HW will consider a packet to be an L2 multicast packet, when
00667         the least-significant bit of the first byte of the DMAC is set and the packet
00668         is not an L2 broadcast packet.
00669         Only applies when the parse mode for the packets is SKIP-TO-L2 */
00670     uint64_t bcast_l2_red_packets; /**< Number of packets with L2 Broadcast DMAC
00671         that were dropped due to RED.
00672         The HW will consider a packet to be an L2 broadcast packet when the 48-bit
00673         DMAC is all 1's.
00674         Only applies when the parse mode for the packets is SKIP-TO-L2 */
00675     uint64_t mcast_l3_red_packets; /**< Number of packets with L3 Multicast Dest Address
00676         that were dropped due to RED.
00677         The HW considers an IPv4 packet to be multicast when the most-significant
00678         nibble of the 32-bit destination address is 0xE (i.e it is a class D address).
00679         The HW considers an IPv6 packet to be multicast when the most-significant byte
00680         of the 128-bit destination address is all 1's.
00681         Only applies when the parse mode for the packets is SKIP-TO-L2 and the packet
00682         is IP or the parse mode for the packet is SKIP-TO-IP */
00683     uint64_t bcast_l3_red_packets; /**< Number of packets with L3 Broadcast Dest Address
00684         that were dropped due to RED.
00685         The HW considers an IPv4 packet to be broadcast when all bits are set in
00686         the MSB of the destination address. IPv6 does not have the concept of
00687         broadcast packets.
00688         Only applies when the parse mode for the packet is SKIP-TO-L2 and the packet
00689         is IP or the parse mode for the packet is SKIP-TO-IP */
00690 };
00691 
00692 /**
00693  * PKI Packet Instruction Header Structure (PKI_INST_HDR_S)
00694  */
00695 typedef union {
00696     uint64_t u64;
00697     struct {
00698         uint64_t w     : 1; /* INST_HDR size: 0 = 2 bytes, 1 = 4 or 8 bytes */
00699         uint64_t raw   : 1; /* RAW packet indicator in WQE[RAW]: 1 = enable */
00700         uint64_t utag  : 1; /* Use INST_HDR[TAG] to compute WQE[TAG]: 1 = enable */
00701         uint64_t uqpg  : 1; /* Use INST_HDR[QPG] to compute QPG: 1 = enable */
00702         uint64_t rsvd1 : 1;
00703         uint64_t pm    : 3; /* Packet parsing mode. Legal values = 0x0..0x7 */
00704         uint64_t sl    : 8; /* Number of bytes in INST_HDR. */
00705         /* The following fields are not present, if INST_HDR[W] = 0: */
00706         uint64_t utt   : 1; /* Use INST_HDR[TT] to compute WQE[TT]: 1 = enable */
00707         uint64_t tt    : 2; /* INST_HDR[TT] => WQE[TT], if INST_HDR[UTT] = 1 */
00708         uint64_t rsvd2 : 2;
00709         uint64_t qpg   :11; /* INST_HDR[QPG] => QPG, if INST_HDR[UQPG] = 1 */
00710         uint64_t tag   :32; /* INST_HDR[TAG] => WQE[TAG], if INST_HDR[UTAG] = 1 */
00711     } s;
00712 } cvmx_pki_inst_hdr_t;
00713 
00714 /**
00715  * This function assignes the clusters to a group, later pkind can be
00716  * configured to use that group depending on number of clusters pkind
00717  * would use. A given cluster can only be enabled in a single cluster group.
00718  * Number of clusters assign to that group determines how many engine can work
00719  * in parallel to process the packet. Eack cluster can process x MPPS.
00720  *
00721  * @param node  Node
00722  * @param cluster_group Group to attach clusters to.
00723  * @param cluster_mask The mask of clusters which needs to be assigned to the group.
00724  */
00725 static inline int cvmx_pki_attach_cluster_to_group(int node, uint64_t cluster_group,
00726          uint64_t cluster_mask)
00727 {
00728     cvmx_pki_icgx_cfg_t pki_cl_grp;
00729 
00730     if (cluster_group >= CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER_GROUP) {
00731         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: config cluster group %d", (int)cluster_group);
00732         return -1;
00733     }
00734     pki_cl_grp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_ICGX_CFG(cluster_group));
00735     pki_cl_grp.s.clusters = cluster_mask;
00736     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_ICGX_CFG(cluster_group), pki_cl_grp.u64);
00737     return 0;
00738 }
00739 
00740 static inline void cvmx_pki_write_global_parse(int node,
00741     struct cvmx_pki_global_parse gbl_pen)
00742 {
00743     cvmx_pki_gbl_pen_t gbl_pen_reg;
00744     gbl_pen_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_GBL_PEN);
00745     gbl_pen_reg.s.virt_pen = gbl_pen.virt_pen;
00746     gbl_pen_reg.s.clg_pen = gbl_pen.clg_pen;
00747     gbl_pen_reg.s.cl2_pen = gbl_pen.cl2_pen;
00748     gbl_pen_reg.s.l4_pen = gbl_pen.l4_pen;
00749     gbl_pen_reg.s.il3_pen = gbl_pen.il3_pen;
00750     gbl_pen_reg.s.l3_pen = gbl_pen.l3_pen;
00751     gbl_pen_reg.s.mpls_pen = gbl_pen.mpls_pen;
00752     gbl_pen_reg.s.fulc_pen = gbl_pen.fulc_pen;
00753     gbl_pen_reg.s.dsa_pen = gbl_pen.dsa_pen;
00754     gbl_pen_reg.s.hg_pen = gbl_pen.hg_pen;
00755     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_GBL_PEN, gbl_pen_reg.u64);
00756 }
00757 
00758 static inline void cvmx_pki_write_tag_secret(int node,
00759     struct cvmx_pki_tag_sec tag_secret)
00760 {
00761     cvmx_pki_tag_secret_t tag_secret_reg;
00762     tag_secret_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_TAG_SECRET);
00763     tag_secret_reg.s.dst6 = tag_secret.dst6;
00764     tag_secret_reg.s.src6 = tag_secret.src6;
00765     tag_secret_reg.s.dst = tag_secret.dst;
00766     tag_secret_reg.s.src = tag_secret.src;
00767     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_TAG_SECRET, tag_secret_reg.u64);
00768 }
00769 
00770 static inline void cvmx_pki_write_ltype_map(int node,
00771         enum cvmx_pki_layer_type layer,
00772         enum cvmx_pki_beltype backend)
00773 {
00774     cvmx_pki_ltypex_map_t ltype_map;
00775     if (layer > CVMX_PKI_LTYPE_E_MAX || backend > CVMX_PKI_BELTYPE_MAX) {
00776         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: invalid ltype beltype mapping\n");
00777         return;
00778     }
00779     ltype_map.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_LTYPEX_MAP(layer));
00780     ltype_map.s.beltype = backend;
00781     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_LTYPEX_MAP(layer), ltype_map.u64);
00782 }
00783 
00784 /**
00785  * This function enables the cluster group to start parsing.
00786  *
00787  * @param node    Node number.
00788  * @param cl_grp  Cluster group to enable parsing.
00789  */
00790 static inline int cvmx_pki_parse_enable(int node, unsigned cl_grp)
00791 {
00792     cvmx_pki_icgx_cfg_t pki_cl_grp;
00793 
00794     if (cl_grp >= CVMX_PKI_NUM_CLUSTER_GROUP) {
00795         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: pki parse en group %d", (int)cl_grp);
00796         return -1;
00797     }
00798     pki_cl_grp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_ICGX_CFG(cl_grp));
00799     pki_cl_grp.s.pena = 1;
00800     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_ICGX_CFG(cl_grp), pki_cl_grp.u64);
00801     return 0;
00802 }
00803 
00804 /**
00805  * This function enables the PKI to send bpid level backpressure to CN78XX inputs.
00806  *
00807  * @param node Node number.
00808  */
00809 static inline void cvmx_pki_enable_backpressure(int node)
00810 {
00811     cvmx_pki_buf_ctl_t pki_buf_ctl;
00812 
00813     pki_buf_ctl.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_BUF_CTL);
00814     pki_buf_ctl.s.pbp_en = 1;
00815     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKI_BUF_CTL, pki_buf_ctl.u64);
00816 }
00817 
00818 /**
00819  * Clear the statistics counters for a port.
00820  *
00821  * @param node Node number.
00822  * @param port Port number (ipd_port) to get statistics for.
00823  *    Make sure PKI_STATS_CTL:mode is set to 0 for collecting per port/pkind stats.
00824  */
00825 void cvmx_pki_clear_port_stats(int node, uint64_t port);
00826 
00827 /**
00828  * Get the status counters for index from PKI.
00829  *
00830  * @param node    Node number.
00831  * @param index   PKIND number, if PKI_STATS_CTL:mode = 0 or
00832  *     style(flow) number, if PKI_STATS_CTL:mode = 1
00833  * @param status  Where to put the results.
00834  */
00835 void cvmx_pki_get_stats(int node, int index, struct cvmx_pki_port_stats *status);
00836 
00837 /**
00838  * Get the statistics counters for a port.
00839  *
00840  * @param node   Node number
00841  * @param port   Port number (ipd_port) to get statistics for.
00842  *    Make sure PKI_STATS_CTL:mode is set to 0 for collecting per port/pkind stats.
00843  * @param status Where to put the results.
00844  */
00845 static inline void cvmx_pki_get_port_stats(int node, uint64_t port,
00846     struct cvmx_pki_port_stats *status)
00847 {
00848     int xipd = cvmx_helper_node_to_ipd_port(node, port);
00849     int xiface = cvmx_helper_get_interface_num(xipd);
00850     int index = cvmx_helper_get_interface_index_num(port);
00851     int pknd = cvmx_helper_get_pknd(xiface, index);
00852     cvmx_pki_get_stats(node, pknd, status);
00853 }
00854 
00855 /**
00856  * Get the statistics counters for a flow represented by style in PKI.
00857  *
00858  * @param node Node number.
00859  * @param style_num Style number to get statistics for.
00860  *    Make sure PKI_STATS_CTL:mode is set to 1 for collecting per style/flow stats.
00861  * @param status Where to put the results.
00862  */
00863 static inline void cvmx_pki_get_flow_stats(int node, uint64_t style_num,
00864     struct cvmx_pki_port_stats *status)
00865 {
00866     cvmx_pki_get_stats(node, style_num, status);
00867 }

01039  * Each channel listens for backpressure on a specific bpid.
01040  * Each bpid can backpressure multiple channels.

01042  * @param bpid  BPID from which channel will receive backpressure.
01043  * @param channel  Channel numner to receive backpressue.

01049  * assert backpressure.

01051  * Multiple auras can backpressure single bpid.

01053  * @param aura  Number which will assert backpressure on that bpid.
01054  * @param bpid  To assert backpressure on.

01059  * Enables/Disabled QoS (RED Drop, Tail Drop & backpressure) for the* PKI aura.
01060  *
01061  * @param node  Node number
01062  * @param aura  To enable/disable QoS on.
01063  * @param ena_red  Enable/Disable RED drop between pass and drop level
01064  *    1-enable 0-disable
01065  * @param ena_drop  Enable/disable tail drop when max drop level exceeds
01066  *    1-enable 0-disable
01067  * @param ena_bp  Enable/Disable asserting backpressure on bpid when
01068  *    max DROP level exceeds.
01069  *    1-enable 0-disable
01070  */
01071 int cvmx_pki_enable_aura_qos(int node, int aura, bool ena_red,
01072         bool ena_drop, bool ena_bp);

01075  * This function gives the initial style used by that pkind.
01076  *

01078  * @param pkind  PKIND number.
01079  */
01080 int cvmx_pki_get_pkind_style(int node, int pkind);
01081 
01082 /**
01083  * This function sets the wqe buffer mode. First packet data buffer can reside
01084  * either in same buffer as wqe OR it can go in separate buffer. If used the later mode,
01085  * make sure software allocate enough buffers to now have wqe separate from packet data.
01086  *
01087  * @param node  Node number.
01088  * @param style  Style to configure.
01089  * @param pkt_outside_wqe 
01090  *    0 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] immediately
01091  *    followed by packet data, in the same buffer as the work queue entry.
01092  *    1 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] in a new
01093  *    buffer separate from the work queue entry. Words following the
01094  *    WQE in the same cache line will be zeroed, other lines in the
01095  *    buffer will not be modified and will retain stale data (from the
01096  *    buffer’s previous use). This setting may decrease the peak PKI
01097  *    performance by up to half on small packets.
01098  */
01099 void cvmx_pki_set_wqe_mode(int node, uint64_t style, bool pkt_outside_wqe);
01100 
01101 /**
01102  * This function sets the Packet mode of all ports and styles to little-endian.
01103  * It Changes write operations of packet data to L2C to
01104  * be in little-endian. Does not change the WQE header format, which is
01105  * properly endian neutral.
01106  *
01107  * @param node  Node number.
01108  * @param style  Style to configure.
01109  */
01110 void cvmx_pki_set_little_endian(int node, uint64_t style);
01111 
01112 /**
01113  * Enables/Disables L2 length error check and max & min frame length checks.
01114  *
01115  * @param node  Node number.
01116  * @param pknd  PKIND to disable error for.
01117  * @param l2len_err  L2 length error check enable.
01118  * @param maxframe_err  Max frame error check enable.
01119  * @param minframe_err  Min frame error check enable.
01120  *    1 -- Enabel err checks
01121  *    0 -- Disable error checks
01122  */
01123 void cvmx_pki_endis_l2_errs(int node, int pknd, bool l2len_err,
01124             bool maxframe_err, bool minframe_err);
01125 
01126 /**
01127  * Enables/Disables fcs check and fcs stripping on the pkind.
01128  *
01129  * @param node  Node number.
01130  * @param pknd  PKIND to apply settings on.
01131  * @param fcs_chk  Enable/disable fcs check.
01132  *    1 -- enable fcs error check.
01133  *    0 -- disable fcs error check.
01134  * @param fcs_strip  Strip L2 FCS bytes from packet, decrease WQE[LEN] by 4 bytes
01135  *    1 -- strip L2 FCS.
01136  *    0 -- Do not strip L2 FCS.
01137  */
01138 void cvmx_pki_endis_fcs_check(int node, int pknd, bool fcs_chk, bool fcs_strip);

01171 /**
01172  * @INTERNAL
01173  * This function is called by cvmx_helper_shutdown() to extract all FPA buffers
01174  * out of the PKI. After this function completes, all FPA buffers that were
01175  * prefetched by PKI will be in the apropriate FPA pool.
01176  * This functions does not reset the PKI.
01177  * WARNING: It is very important that PKI be reset soon after a call to this function.
01178  *
01179  * @param node  Node number.
01180  */
01181 void __cvmx_pki_free_ptr(int node);
